entry.title: Re: Why Does SAP B1 Allow Backdated Delivery Without Inve...
entry.content:
Hi,

  • Why deliveries were allowed

    • SAP B1 checks stock at posting time, not by historical date.

    • Because “Allow stock release without item cost” was enabled, the system allowed deliveries even before stock existed.

  • Moving Average calculation

    • Deliveries before GR were posted at cost 0.

    • When GR was posted, system recalculated Moving Average and adjusted COGS via automatic revaluation.

  • Best practices / controls

    • Disable Allow stock release without item cost.

    • Keep Block Negative Inventory active.

    • Lock old posting periods to prevent backdating.

    • Use approvals for deliveries with earlier dates than receipts.

Regards,
Faraz Maqsud.

entry.title: Re: Journal Voucher Journal Entry
entry.content:
Hello,

  • Journal Entries are stored in OJDT / JDT1.

  • Journal Vouchers are stored in OJVT / JVT1.

  • To trace: OJDT.BaseRef or OJDT.Ref1 = Journal Voucher number.

  • In the client → open JE → check Remarks/Ref fields to see the voucher number.

Example:-

SELECT
JE.TransId AS JournalEntryID,
JE.Number AS JournalEntryNum,
JE.Ref1 AS Ref1,
JE.Ref2 AS Ref2,
JE.BaseRef AS BaseRef,
JV.TransId AS JVTransId,
JV.Number AS JournalVoucherNum,
JE.Memo AS Remarks,
JE.RefDate AS PostingDate
FROM OJDT JE
LEFT JOIN OJVT JV ON JE.TransId = JV.TransId
ORDER BY JE.RefDate, JE.TransId;

Regards,
Faraz Maqsud.

entry.title: Re: Issue with a simple FMS
entry.content:
Hello,

Try This !

SELECT $[RDR1.PriceBefDi] * $[RDR1.U_Tariff] / 100

  • Remove .NUMBER → it causes the SQL error.

  • Ensure U_Tariff UDF is type Percent (numeric).

  • Assign this query as FMS to your result UDF (e.g. U_TotalTariff).

  • Set the FMS to auto-refresh when U_Tariff changes.

Regards,
Faraz Maqsud.

entry.title: Re: Need to apply validation to restrict back date billin...
entry.content: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud provides in-app extensibility via Cloud BAdIs. For your scenario, the most relevant enhancement option is BAdI SD_BILLING_DOCUMENT_CHECK. This allows you to implement custom validation logic before a billing document is created. Triggered during billing document creation from the Billing Due List. You can write logic to compare the billing date with the current system date and raise an error if it's in the past beyond your allowed threshold.  SAP Help Portal explains the Create Billing Documents and its extensibility options

Dear @JM_1 ,

Many thanks for your feedback and your example. I will check it together with my colleagues today.

If I got you right, in PMGM, there is still the possibility to have for every individual goal (of the same Goal Plan) different target levels (also after the H1/2025 release)?

So, for the Individual Goal XY, we would have the following metric lookup table:

Target Baseline=1000

  • Target Level 250 - Score 1
  • Target Level 500 - Score 2
  • Target Level 750 - Score 3
  • Target Level 1000 - Score 4
  • Target Level 1250 - Score 5 

And for the second Individual Goal AB (of the same Goal Plan), we would have the following metric lookup table:

Target Baseline=500

  • Target Level 25- Score 1
  • Target Level 50- Score 2
  • Target Level 75- Score 3
  • Target Level 100- Score 4
  • Target Level 125- Score 5 

Furthermore, could you explain me please, why our customized solution does not work anymore correctly since the new Release H1/2025. Before this release, this customized solution worked without any problems.

Many thanks in advance for your help and support.

Best Regards.

entry.title: How to restrict visibility of integration packages in SAP CPI (Integration Suite)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a project where we create integration flows for multiple countries in SAP CPI (Integration Suite). Each country has its own set of CPI developers who should only work on their respective country’s packages/iflows and I need to restrict access to certain integration packages so that some users cannot see or access them.

Our requirement is:

  • Country A developers should only see and work on Country A’s packages.

  • Country B developers should only see and work on Country B’s packages.

  • And so on…

I have checked Access Policies they do not prevent users from seeing the other packages/iflows in the tenant.

My questions:

  1. Is there a way to completely hide integration packages from developers who are not authorized?

  2. If full visibility restriction is not possible, what are the recommended best practices for structuring roles and access policies in such multi-country projects?

  3. Is there any roadmap from SAP to introduce package-level visibility restrictions in CPI?

Any advice or workaround would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!


SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: Re: How to complete I9 step with a new employee that does...
entry.content:
@Cristiane1 

The I-9 can be submitted without SSN but SSN is required for everify.

If the new hire did not provide a Social Security Number (SSN) and the employer is using E-Verify employment eligibility verification, the Correct I-9 to-do task is triggered. The Complete Form I-9 Section 1 Awaiting SSN task appears on the home page and the new hire is sent an email notification prompting them to provide their SSN for employment verification.

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-onboarding/implementing-onboarding/uscis-form-i-9

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: Re: Customizing Extraction Fields in SAP Document Informa...
entry.content:
Hi Kevin

Good luck with your testing.

Be aware of one important limitation before you really start testing. The Trial version only allows very little test runs. I think the limit is 50 PDF pages per month, so if you for example would like to test performance with big documents and load a PDF with 40 pages, then you can only make one testrun per month.

That limit is ridiculously low - almost useless. When I finally had it running and was going to do some real test, the limit was reached. 😤

So, I set up a new email and a new trial account to keep testing. I am on my 4th trial account, but now I am so lucky that I have a customer and a POC project with a pay-as-you go licence.

There are also other limitations as you can see in the documentation here Free Tier Option and Trial Account Technical Constraints | SAP Help Portal.

So use your 50 test pages wisely.

entry.title: Re: Recreate interface data which was triggerred by Event...
entry.content:
Hello @makinom 

Dear Masatomo,

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud integrated with BTP Integration Suite and Event Mesh, there is no single resend button for event-triggered messages. The approach depends on the type of integration object:

  1. For Events Triggered via Event Mesh
  • Events are fire-and-forget once published to Event Mesh and consumed, they are not stored indefinitely.
  • If a consumer iFlow or application fails, Event Mesh can temporarily hold the message if the subscription or queue is configured with persistence and retries.
  • If the message is lost, you typically retrigger the event by re-executing the business action in S/4HANA for example, change & save the business object again or by using custom re-publish logic via side-by-side extension or utility APIs.
  1. For OData/ SOAP / IDoc-Based Interfaces
  • S/4HANA Cloud provides Application Interface Framework or Message Monitoring apps to check failed messages.
  • From there, you can often reprocess or resend failed payloads directly without changing business data.
  • In SAP BTP Integration Suite, failed iFlow messages can be retried manually in Monitor → Manage Integration Content.
  1. I suggest the following Best Practices for Go-Live & Troubleshooting
  • Build your integration so that the same message can be safely re-sent without creating duplicates. Ensure your iFlows and event consumers are designed to be idempotent.
  • Where possible, configure your Event Mesh queues with persistence so that failed deliveries can be retried automatically.
  • You should consider the following error Handling Strategy:
    • Monitor failed iFlows in Integration Suite → Retry.  Resend/Retry Interchanges
    • Use S/4HANA Message Dashboard / Communication Monitoring for resend where available.
    • For Event Mesh events, provide a way which can be an API call or small utility app to re-publish the event in case of troubleshooting.

This is the recommended SAP best practice to handle data resend both during testing and post go-live. Consult the following links for more details.

 

Configure SAP Application Interface Framework

SAP Application Interface Framework

Apply the Retry Pattern with JMS Queue

 

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

entry.title: Re: How to add additional fields to VF45 transaction ALV...
entry.content:
Since VF45 is a standard report with limited enhancement options, the most reliable approach is to:

  • Copy the standard program behind VF45 into a Z-report
  • Enhance the data retrieval logic to include your custom fields
  • Extend the ALV output structure to accommodate those fields
  • Adjust the field catalog to display them properly

This gives you full control over the layout and logic and avoids the limitations of the standard report.

entry.title: Re: Activity Cost Rate validity
entry.content:
Even though you’ve entered the valid-from date as 01.01.2025, the system might still display the validity year as 2024 due to:

Fiscal year variant misalignment: If your cost center is linked to a company code with a fiscal year variant that doesn’t start on January 1st, SAP may interpret the validity period differently.

Defaulting behavior in the app: The app sometimes defaults to the current or previous year when displaying rates, especially if the fiscal year context isn’t explicitly set during entry.

What you can do is go to the cost center’s company code and check its fiscal year variant. If it’s not K4 (Jan–Dec), the system may interpret 01.01.2025 as part of fiscal year 2024.

If the cost center is assigned to multiple company codes, the app may not correctly identify which fiscal year variant to use. In this case, you need to explicitly specify the company code when maintaining the rate. SAP Help Portal notes that if the fiscal year variant cannot be identified (e.g., due to multiple company codes), you must specify the company code manually to ensure the correct validity period is applied. Go through this SAP Help documentation 

If you’re maintaining rates per ledger, ensure that the ledger-specific validity is correctly set. The app prioritizes ledger-specific rates over non-ledger-specific ones

entry.title: Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

 

Hello Everyone,

With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the Sourcing and Procurement line of business continues to evolve, bringing forward innovations that empower procurement professionals to operate with greater agility, transparency, and collaboration. This release focuses on enhancing core procurement processes, integrating intelligent technologies, and improving user experience across the board. Let’s take a closer look at the key updates and how they support your procurement transformation journey.

 

For other releases please see here. Check out all demos in a playlist here.

Operational Procurement

  • Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header
  • Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow
  • Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval
  • Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow
  • V4 API for intracompany stock transfer
  • Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes
  • Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App
  • Extensibility in manage source lists app
  • Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

  • Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

SAP Arabia Central Procurement

  • Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts
  • Procurement Expansion Package

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

Document Management System attachments on the purchase requisition header

The integration of the Document Management System (DMS) at the header level of purchase requisitions marks a significant improvement in how procurement teams manage documentation. Professional purchasers can now attach relevant documents directly to requisitions, with the ability to classify them for internal or external use. While external classification will be supported in future updates, the current functionality already streamlines documentation processes and ensures consistency across SAP Fiori applications such as “Manage Purchase Requisition – Professional” and “Create Purchase Requisition – Advanced.” This enhancement simplifies audit trails, improves traceability, and fosters better collaboration between procurement teams and stakeholders.

 

For more information, see: Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional

Ability to provide ad hoc approver for purchase order workflow

Procurement workflows often require flexibility, especially when exceptional circumstances arise. The introduction of ad-hoc approvers allows authorized users to dynamically add individuals to a workflow instance based on the context of a specific purchase order. This capability ensures that critical decisions are not delayed due to rigid approval chains. The ability to designate multiple ad-hoc approvers and track their involvement in the approval history adds a layer of transparency and responsiveness, making procurement processes more agile and context-aware.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Orders 

Reviewer workflow for purchase order approval

SAP has introduced a reviewer step in purchase order workflows, allowing designated users to monitor workflow progress and provide feedback without having approval authority. This feature is particularly valuable for organizations that require compliance checks, financial oversight, or legal reviews before finalizing purchases. By enabling user-based or role-based recipient selection and allowing deadline settings, SAP ensures that the review process is both structured and adaptable. This innovation enhances governance and fosters a collaborative approach to procurement decision-making.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

Enhanced account assignment categories as start conditions for purchase order workflow

The ability to use account assignment categories—such as Internal Order, Asset, and Sales Order—as workflow triggers provides organizations with granular control over procurement approvals. These categories can now be defined as start conditions for purchase order workflows, allowing organizations to tailor approval processes based on financial responsibility and operational context. Additionally, step conditions can be configured to assign specific individuals responsible for each category, ensuring that approvals are targeted and relevant. This supports better financial stewardship and operational alignment.

 

For more information, see:  Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders

 

V4 API for intracompany stock transfer

SAP’s introduction of a new OData V4 API for intracompany stock transfers enables external applications to create, read, update, and delete stock transport orders in real time. This API-driven approach supports seamless integration with external systems, facilitating efficient stock movement across organizational units and enhancing data accuracy. The inclusion of error messaging ensures that invalid data is promptly flagged, reducing the risk of discrepancies and improving overall inventory control.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Stock Transport Order (CE_STOCKTRANSPORTORDER_0001) and Stock Transport Order (OData V4)

Maintenance of supplier confirmation notes

Supplier collaboration is enhanced through the automatic integration of supplier confirmation notes into purchase orders. When suppliers provide notes during the confirmation process, these are now automatically transferred to the corresponding purchase order and its items. This ensures that supplier input is accurately captured and reflected throughout the procurement lifecycle. By reducing manual data entry and minimizing the risk of miscommunication, this feature improves order accuracy and strengthens supplier relationships.

 

For more information, see: Manage Supplier Confirmations

Enable account assignment category Q in Manage Purchase Contracts App

Project-based procurement receives a boost with the inclusion of account assignment category Q (project stock) in the Manage Purchase Contract app. This enables organizations to handle make-to-order scenarios with greater precision, including the management of fields such as WBS elements and GL accounts. By extending support to project procurement, SAP empowers industries like construction, engineering, and manufacturing to align purchasing activities with project timelines and budgets.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see:  Manage Purchase Contracts

Extensibility in manage source lists app

The Manage Source List app has been enhanced to support custom fields, allowing users to store business-specific information that aids in sourcing decisions. Previously, the app did not permit the addition of custom fields, limiting its flexibility. With the new capability, users can define fields of various types—such as string, date, and decimal—and manage them using provided BADIs. This extensibility supports tailored data management and improves the efficiency of source list maintenance.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Source Lists and Overview of Changes in Extensibility Objects

Viewing distributed value still to be invoiced in the purchase order items by account assignment app

Financial transparency is further improved with the ability to view pending invoice values distributed across account assignment splits in purchase order items. When a purchase order item is assigned to multiple cost objects, such as cost centers or internal orders, users can now monitor the open invoice amount proportionally per assignment line. This granular visibility supports accurate accruals, budget tracking, and financial reporting, enabling organizations to maintain tighter control over their expenditures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Purchase Order Items by Account Assignment 

Procurement Expansion Package

The Procurement Expansion Package (PEP) consolidates advanced operational procurement features, catalog content channels, and supplier network capabilities into a single offering. Designed for SAP Cloud ERP customers, PEP delivers comprehensive spend coverage, improved compliance, and enhanced supplier collaboration. It supports a consumer-grade shopping experience, touchless supplier interactions, and end-to-end visibility across procurement processes. By digitizing manual transactions and centralizing procurement data, PEP helps organizations achieve greater efficiency, transparency, and strategic value.

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

 

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management

Input tax – Calculation, verification, and validation using external tax engines

Tax compliance is a critical aspect of procurement, and SAP addresses this through integration with external tax engines like Vertex and Thomson Reuters in SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management. This integration allows for the calculation, verification, and validation of VAT, GST, and other transaction taxes on supplier invoices. By automating tax determination and comparison with supplier-provided data, organizations can prevent overpayments, mitigate compliance risks, and enhance audit readiness. The ability to specify commodity codes and use address data for tax calculation further refines the accuracy of this process.

 

 

For more information, see: Verification of Tax Applied to a Supplier Invoice

Sourcing and Procurement in SAP Ariba Central Procurement

Enablement of single-line distributions from central purchase contracts

Central procurement capabilities have been expanded in two key areas. First, the activation of single-line distribution within central contracts allows organizations to generate individual outline agreements for each contract line item. This is particularly beneficial for industries such as automotive, where scheduling agreements often require single-item configurations. Second, when copying a central contract, users can now edit fields such as supplier and purchasing organization, providing greater flexibility in contract lifecycle management and enabling smoother transitions when suppliers change.

 

 

 

 

For more information, see: Manage Central Purchase Contracts

 

Don’t hesitate to leave a comment and check out our community page to ask your questions and engage with the experts. Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts.

entry.title: Re: Asset Accounting - What is ECC t-code ABSK in S/4Hana...

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP - SAP BAS Deployment failed npm error Missing...
entry.content:
Hi @RAP1705 

Since the issue persists, here are a few additional checks I suggest you do:

  1. Verify the Entry File
  • By default, Cloud Application Programming projects expect server.js as the entry file.
  • If your file is named service.js, you either need to:
    • Rename service.js → server.js, or
    • Update your package.json to explicitly declare the entry point:
    • main: service.js
  1. Ensure cds-serve is Available
  • Confirm that @sap/cds-dk is installed locally or globally:
  • Without this, cds-serve will not be recognized during deployment.
  1. Module Structure
  • If you have multiple modules only the Node.js service module requires a start script.
  • Ensure you are deploying from the correct module root the one containing package.json with start: cds-serve.
  1. Ensur you double check Note 3208515

SAP Note 3208515 confirms that the missing start script error typically occurs because Cloud Foundry requires start in package.json to know how to launch the app.
https://me.sap.com/loading?utm

  1. Cloud Foundry Manifest
  • In your manifest.yml, ensure the start command isn’t overridden incorrectly.

Here is my suggested next Step:

Given your setup service.js as entry file, the most likely fix is either renaming it to server.js or declaring it as the main entry in your package.json.

Try this and redeploy. It should resolve the error.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Purchase Order Number Prefixing
entry.content:
There are already options to attach different Number Ranges to Purchase Order Types.

  • SSCUI: 103412 to create a new number range intervals according to the business case.
  • SSCUI: 102909 to assign the new number range to the customized PO document type/RFQ/Quotations.

There is also a KBA for alphabetic number ranges 3596398 - Alpha Numeric Number Range for Central Purchase Order (Public Cloud) and note 3449542 - Customer Adaptation on Procure Number Range Intervals (but the content for this document is being improved and a new version is in preparation but not released yet.)

entry.title: Re: MR11 Issue
entry.content:
Based on the scenario you've described; including the GR, MIRO, credit memo, partial return, and scrap — the quantity has been fully accounted for, but there's still a small value difference due to planned delivery costs (e.g., $0.95).

Since there's no stock available to reverse and reprocess the GR, the best way to clear this difference is by using Transaction MR11. This allows you to manually clear the remaining value in the GR/IR account.

Please ensure that your difference account (DIF) is correctly configured in OBYC so the posting goes through smoothly. If needed, you can also document the scrap and freight variance in the MR11 posting text for audit clarity.

entry.title: Post-Implementation Optimization Guide : Keeping Your SAP SuccessFactors Running Smoothly
entry.content:
Successfully implementing SAP SuccessFactors is a significant milestone, but it's just the beginning of your HR transformation journey. As business requirements evolve and your organization grows, your SuccessFactors environment needs regular attention to maintain optimal performance.

Why Post-Implementation Review Matters

Over time, even the best-configured systems can develop inefficiencies. Business processes change, new features are released, user needs evolve, and what worked perfectly at go-live may no longer serve your organization effectively. Without regular maintenance, organizations often experience:

  • Slower workflows
  • Outdated configurations
  • User frustration
  • Missed opportunities for automation

Key Areas to Monitor

System Performance Regular review of system configurations, integration health, and data quality ensures your platform continues running smoothly. This includes checking workflow efficiency, process performance, and overall system responsiveness.

Security and Compliance Role-based permissions, security settings, and compliance requirements need ongoing attention. Regular audits help identify potential vulnerabilities and ensure your system meets current regulatory standards.

Feature Utilization SAP regularly releases new features and enhancements. Many organizations miss opportunities to leverage capabilities they're already licensed for, simply because they haven't reviewed what's available since implementation.

User Experience Monitoring user adoption patterns, gathering feedback, and identifying pain points helps ensure your SuccessFactors investment continues delivering value to end users.

Practical Tools and Actions

Leverage SAP's Built-in Diagnostics. SAP provides a built-in Check Tool that automates system diagnostics, identifying configuration issues, security gaps, and performance bottlenecks. Regular use of this tool helps catch problems before they impact users.

HR Administrator Actions

  • Monitor user adoption metrics through system analytics
  • Review and clean up inactive user accounts and outdated role assignments
  • Audit workflow approvals for bottlenecks and delays
  • Validate data integrity across modules through standard reports

Business User Involvement

  • Gather regular feedback from managers and employees on system usability
  • Document new business requirements as they emerge
  • Identify manual workarounds that could be automated
  • Track which features are underutilized and why

Proactive Maintenance

  • Subscribe to SAP release notes to stay informed about new features
  • Establish regular configuration backup procedures
  • Monitor integration endpoints for data synchronization issues
  • Review and update security permissions quarterly

Regular Tasks for Partner Consultants

  • Instance Refresh: Refresh Preview and Development instances from Production to ensure consistent testing environments with current data
  • Data Cleanup: Remove inactive and outdated data, close previous year forms, and purge obsolete records
  • System Maintenance: Perform cache clearance and system optimization tasks
  • Job Monitoring: Check and monitor scheduled jobs to ensure all background processes are running successfully
  • Security Updates: Execute RBP refresh and role recertification processes
  • Integration Sync: Ensure HRIS synchronization and third-party system connectivity

Benefits of Regular Optimization

Organizations that regularly review and optimize their SuccessFactors environment typically see:

  • Improved system performance
  • Reduced support costs
  • Better user satisfaction
  • Stronger compliance

More importantly, they ensure their HR technology investment continues supporting business objectives as they evolve.

Moving Forward

Like a garden that requires regular tending to flourish, your SuccessFactors system needs continuous care and attention. Whether through internal resources or external expertise, ongoing optimization ensures your HR investment continues growing in value rather than becoming neglected and underperforming.

The key is establishing a regular cadence of review and improvement, ensuring your SuccessFactors investment continues delivering value long after the initial implementation.

Thank you for taking the time to read.

You are welcome to express your views and ask any queries in the comment section of this blog. I would be pleased to impart my knowledge to you.  Share this blog with your colleagues.

Additional Blogs

If you are a Fresher and looking to specialize in Success Factors, check out my blog - Guide to Mastering SuccessFactors Consulting  You will find valuable insights and practical tips to get expertise and establish yourself as an expert in the industry.

If you are planning an SAP SuccessFactors implementation, check out my blog - Prep Guide for a Flawless SAP SuccessFactors Implementation  This expert guide offers critical insights for a flawless project.

If you are looking to get certified in SAP SuccessFactors, check out my blog -The Proven Way to Prepare for SAP SuccessFactors Certification

 With all my experience, here is the checklist I made to find a resourceful consultant. Hope this helps the other recruiters and the SF interview panel while hiring. check out my blog -Things recruiters/interview panel should look into when hiring an SAP SF consultant


Thank you!!

entry.title: Re: Focused Build how to create customized color for test...
entry.content:
Hello
no it is not possible to have own color.
In Focused Build we have:
1) Test Step Status settings - which is relevant for Test Step Progress Monitor
2) Test Case Status Settings - which is considered for Test Suite Dashboard - Test Status

Depending on this, if you map your custom status to a color - it will be shown in the dashboard. Having own color is not possible. 
If you want to have also an own column for your status in Test Suite Dashboard - own customizing for this is needed.
See SPRO Activity - SAP Solution Manager - Focused Build - Test Suite Extensions - Test Suite Dashboard -  Define Custom Fields for Analytical List Pages  

Best Regards
SAP Support

entry.title: From Research to Real-World Impact: PhD Visit at SAP Labs Munich
entry.content:
The visit was part of regularly PhD Hub Meetings taking place across different SAP locations designed to foster dialogue, connect academic research with industry practice, and strengthen the bridge between SAP and the PhD community. SAP Labs Munich offered the ideal setting for this exchange: located on a joint campus shared by SAP and TUM, it’s a unique space where industry and academia already work side by side in an environment of interdisciplinary collaboration.

The Meeting started with a guided tour through the SAP Experience Center Munich, a place where innovation becomes tangible. Here, the PhD participants explored a wide range of real-life demos, interactive showcases, and SAP use cases. These weren’t just abstract technologies, but concrete examples of how SAP helps businesses operate profitably, adapt continuously, and create a lasting global impact. Representing a global network, the Experience Center served as a dynamic environment that encouraged the young researchers to ask critical questions and connect their research interests with hands-on technology.

After the tour, everyone came together for a joint lunch to connect with SAP colleagues, share insights from their research, and explore new ways to bridge the gap between academia and industry. The event exemplified what’s possible when academic talent and industry innovation come together in an open and inspiring environment. We look forward to continuing this journey, deepening connections, and creating more moments of shared learning and innovation.

 

Further Links: 

SAP Research Community 

UCC TUM

SAP@TUM Industry-University Collaboration

SAP Labs Munich and TUM Campus

entry.title: Re: Push notifications using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
Hello @ManojKumar9 ,

I have successfully enabled push notifications in SAP Build Apps (not MDK/Fiori). 

1. SAP Build Apps Preview App doesn't support push notifications.
2. It should be possible to use push notifications from SAP Build Apps only on published Apps (App Store/ Play Market). To use this notifications you can use FCM (Firebase Cloud Messaging). But I did not test that.
3. In my case, I did not want to publish my App to the stores (App Store/ Play Market). So I found SAP Start App as a solution for me.

It is an app which you connect to your Work Zone. Any notification that can pop-up on Work Zone site will be pushed into your phone from Mobile Start. You can check Sap Mobile Start Journey, there are a lot of information about that. Then you need to configure your Sap Build Apps app to send notifications to your Work Zone site. There is not bad documentation for that, and I have got a post about all the issues I faced here: https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/notifications-from-sap-build-apps-to-work-zone/m-p/14179924#M2042297 
 So the logic will be like that:
1. You send notification from your app to the Work Zone Site
2. If you connected Sap Mobile Start app, the Work zone would automatically send push notification to your phone.

Hope it will help you. I am still waiting the response from SAP Support about the FCM configuration. When I will get a response, I can share it with you too.

Best regards,
Vladyslav

entry.title: Re: For object number TM0000000002QL there is no status o...
entry.content:
In MM03, verify that the QM view is maintained. Inspection type Z01 is active. The inspection setup is complete

Go to SPRO → Quality Management → Quality Inspection → Inspection Lot Creation. Verify that inspection type Z01 is correctly assigned to the material. Ensure that status profile is assigned and active

Run Report RQSTOBJ which checks and rebuilds missing status objects for QM documents. You can run it for the affected inspection lot number (if known) or for a range

Also have a look at SAP notes

SAP Note 536769: Addresses missing status object issues
SAP Note 2558352: Related to dumps in MIGO due to missing status objects

entry.title: Create entity of different Business Object from action in dev extension of Manage Sales Order V2
entry.content:
Hello,

I’m working on an extension for Manage Sales Orders V2. This standard application is unmanaged without draft.

I’m trying to create an application which can receive the information that the user has already entered in Manage SO through an action in Manage SO. I will implement another action which fetches the data from the custom app in the Manage SO app.

If the sales order already exists it’s not a problem since you can read it with EML from the new app. If the order hasn’t been created yet, it’s only possible to work with it in local mode which is not possible from the behaviour of my BO.

My approach so far:

For example, if I just want to transfer Sold-to party and Sales Order Type

  • Create table with the following fields: (key) GUID, (not key) Sales order number, Sales order type, Sold-to party
  • Create append structure to VBAK with GUID which will include the GUID of the draft
  • Add the newly created GUID fields in VBAK to all the layers of the I_ R_ and C_SALESORDERMANAGE
  • Create CDS Views, managed behavior, service etc for the custom app
  • Create a custom action in Manage SO which does a Create entity (I tried both in in draft mode and not) on my custom BO. Take the generated GUID from the Mapped structure of the Create statement and write it into the append structure of VBAK through EML on R_SALESORDERTP in the implementation of the action.

The result is that if the Sales Order already exists, I get the newly created GUID in the mapped structure of my “Create” operation in the action and I can see it in the custom app. If the action doesn’t exist, the Create statement still runs, gives back a GUID in the mapped structure but the new entry isn’t written into the custom draft table of the custom BO until the new SO has been saved.

This seems inconsistent. Why would the mapped structure give me the expected GUID but the entity not actually be created?

As a sidenote, I thought about implementing my new functionality through node extension to be able to use "in local mode" instead of custom application, but the Manage Sales Order behavior doesn’t have the @allowNewCompositions: true annotation.

Has anyone run into something similar? I’m also open to different approaches to moving data between apps if it’s only available “in local mode”.

All the best,

Ben

entry.title: Fixed Installment plan for Heavy Equipment OTC Process along with Down payment advance.
entry.content:
Our Business Requirement is similar to what is explained by SAP on help portal regarding Installment plan find the below link.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/7b24a64d9d0941bda1afa753263d9e39/b470b6535fe6b74ce10000000a174cb4.html

Installment Plan | SAP Help Portal

While configuring the system I am coming across few challenges and need an expert opinion to configure it in a proper way.

 

Business Scenario:

Fixed Installment plan for Heavy Equipment OTC Process along with Down payment advance.

While buying a Heavy Equipment Customer Signs a Deal worth of SAR 1,000,000 with 30 % Percent as a down payment and the remaining amount should be paid within a 12 Month equal installment plan.

The Break down should be as below:

Down payment: SAR 300,000

Credit amount: SAR 700,000

Monthly installments: SAR 58,333 of 12 months

Down payment:

  • Down Payment Condition Type (AZFP) is Added in Pricing Procedure along with statistical Check.
  • User will provide the Down payment condition type manually in sales order header 300000
  • Payment Terms configured with 12 months of equal installments.

 

Sales Order Creation:

Order Value: SAR 1,000,000 (PR00) Price Including Down Payment – Heavy Equipment Price is determined through Condition Record. Down payment value 300,000 is included in PR00.

Down payment: SAR 300,000 (AZFP) Statistical Condition No Impact on Net Value (Condition Entered Manually by user at header level).

Payment Terms: Z12M (12 Months Fixed Installment) – User will maintain Payment Terms Z12M at header level manually.

Challenge:

  • System is calculating the 12 Months installments based on the Order Net Value which is 1,000,000 based on the payment terms. (1,000,000/12 = 83333.3).
  • The System should consider value 7,00,000 for 12 months equal installment by considering an advance:

Order Value (1,000,000)

Advance (3,00,000)  

12 Months Installment should be on 7,00,000 (Order Value – Advance)

 

  • Currently the calculation of payment terms installments is happening on 1,000,000 expectation is it should be on 7,00,000.
  • Business is Maintain the PR00 value inclusive of Down payment.

 

 

 

Can you please let me know a possible approach to address this requirement.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management & Risk 2508 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Supplier Management Integration with WalkMe (SLP-2265)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and SAP Ariba Supplier Information and Performance Management (new architecture) with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

Supplier Management WalkMe integration includes several standard smart walk-throughs from SAP Ariba for common workflows. Customers can also choose to develop their own content by first purchasing WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. For more information about WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions, see https://walkme.com

If you have an SAP Companion help system enabled, its help content remains available.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in Supplier Management (SLP-2258)
Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in supplier management. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

(IMPORTANT: AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance will be in early access until September 19th, 2025, at which time it will be made generally available to customers.)

View implementation details and more here.

For the list of tasks that you can perform using Joule, refer to the topic Joule Capabilities in Supplier Management.

 

Displaying Comments when Updates are Requested for a Modular Questionnaire (SLP-2272)
Modular questionnaires allow continuous updates or permanently close after the submitted answers are first approved or denied. Requesting an update reopens the questionnaire so that the recipient can update it once. When you request an update to a modular questionnaire and enter an (optional) comment about the update request, the comment along with its timestamp is now displayed in the Comments section of the modular questionnaire.For example, the comment is displayed in this manner: "UserXYZ has requested an update for questionnaireABC".

View implementation details and more here.

 

Option to Join the SAP User Research Panel (SRISK-1771)
This feature provides you an option to join the SAP User Research Panel, where you can share your thoughts and ideas to enhance SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and other SAP products you currently use.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Inherent Risk Screening Questionnaire Information (SRISK-1415)
This feature introduces a new version of the Supplier Risk Engagements API. In addition to the other existing capabilities, this new version lets you retrieve questionnaires, answers, and answer types of inherent risk screening questionnaires to provide better insights to plan your organization's operational needs.

View implementation details and more here.

 

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk Integration with WalkMe (SRISK-1714)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Risk with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Supplier Risk Engagements API Retrieves Domain-Based Residual Risk Score (SRISK-1731)
This feature enables Supplier Risk Engagements API to retrieve domain-based residual risk score for Information Security, Data Privacy, and Compliance domains at the control, engagement, and supplier levels.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Risk Exposure Summary Report Displays Overall Residual and Inherent Risk Levels (SRISK-1763)

This feature provides information about the inherent and residual risk levels of suppliers in the Risk Exposure Summary report. This crucial information aids in making informed decisions when engaging with suppliers.

In addition to the existing risk exposure information, the Risk Exposure Summary report now includes two additional columns to provide inherent and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Changes to the User Interface - Currently, the Risk Exposure Summary report summarizes the overall risk exposure, and category-wise risk exposure such as legal and regulatory, environmental and social, and operational risk exposure. This enhancement introduces two additional columns to display overall inherent risk level and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Stay connected with our community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2508 release (August 12-14, 2025)
  • Resources
    • Feature related materials:
      • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
      • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)

entry.title: Problems faced while using my SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
Dear Members,

I have used SAP BTP trial account previously and now I have started using it again after a gap. This time though I encountered few problems. I tried searching online for solutions and they didn't work so I deleted my account. Before I create my trial account again, I wanted to cross check if I am doing anything wrong.

  1. I created my trial account and used ABAP booster as per Create an SAP BTP ABAP Environment Trial User | SAP Tutorials

Problem 1 - After creating my ABAP Cloud project in ADT, I noticed that although I can save my work, Transport Management is disabled for all the objects. Transport screen is blank; all radio buttons are disabled. Strangely my work is saved somewhere. Images are attached below. Please note that I can create TRs using ADT.

 

 

Problem 2 - I created a RAP service with CRUD. I get following error message while publishing the service. This is the first time I have encountered this error and don't understand what is wrong. As far as I know the ADT & Eclipse both have latest versions and updates. I get same error when I publish/unpublish a service. What I have noticed is List Report is generated but Create button is disabled in every service.

 

My aim is creating OData service and then consuming it using SAP Build and UI5/Fiori. I think there might be some changes regarding how to setup the trial account, but I don't understand exactly what I am missing. Previously when I did RAP development, I did not encounter these issues.

Any help/advise is greatly appreciated.

Regards

Abhijit

entry.title: Re: The voucher splitting zero balance account failed to...
entry.content:
Dear @Zhijun_Xie ,

to ensure that a Profit Center is always derived and displayed in the General Ledger view for each account and line item, please review the configuration of Document Splitting Characteristics for General Ledger Accounting.
The Mandatory Field setting must be activated for the field Profit Center.

I am sharing two screenshots where you can verify the configuration.

Navigate to Configuration Activity ID 102322 and review the settings for the Profit Center field.

 

Please let me know if you require any further assistance with this matter.

 

Thank you and BR

Dilan

entry.title: Creating a completely custom form in SAP Public Cloud 2508 triggered from MES for Production Complet
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 and need to generate an output label for Production Operation Notifications that is not available in the standard templates.

The key requirement is that this label should be generated from our MES system when a production order is completed, directly in the notification.

Our goal is to create the label from scratch because there are no templates for the case we need, but we have not found clear documentation on how to do this in Public Cloud, since we usually use existing templates in the Manage Form Templates app and Adobe LiveCycle Designer.

My specific questions are:

  1. Is it possible to create a form completely from scratch in Public Cloud, without relying on predefined templates?

  2. How would the fields from the Production module (e.g., operation notifications) be connected to the form?

  3. Are there recommended alternatives to generate custom labels triggered from the MES system when a production order completes?

Additionally, if anyone has SAP documentation, notes, or guides related to this topic, I would be extremely grateful, as I have found very little information for Public Cloud.

I would greatly appreciate any guidance, examples, or SAP notes that could help address this scenario.

Thank you in advance.

SAP Forms service by Adobe SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Manufacturing

entry.title: Re: After Rebase how to perform Merge Activity in SAP S4...
entry.content:
Hello @yanaginouchi 

Thank you for your enquiry. Regarding the step-by-step process for performing the merge activity after a rebase in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition with a 3-system landscape, here is a detailed guide aligned with SAP’s official documentation.

  1. Log in to SAP Central Business Configuration (CBC) and navigate to your project.
  2. Open the Export Software Collection app and select the software collection containing the changes for merging.
  3. Launch the Merge Wizard by clicking the Merge button.
  4. Choose the target collection (main line) with which you want to merge your changes.
  5. Review the validation results for any errors or dependencies and resolve these before proceeding.
  6. Confirm and execute the merge.
  7. After merging, the software collection will become read-only.
  8. Certain data, such as master data and key user extensibility, are excluded from the merge and must be handled separately.

This method guarantees a controlled and consistent merge process, preserving system integrity across your landscape.

For more information, please consult the SAP Help Portal documentation on Rebase and Merge.
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/460606a8edf440f3b2073e058e64dfb3.html
and
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/9c18ee2e4b6e4ff88ee1a44641e7c9a2.html

Please feel free to get in touch if you require any further assistance

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: What’s New in SAP Central Business Configuration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508
entry.content:
With the latest release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, exciting new features are available in SAP Central Business Configuration. This blog post will provide you with a concise overview.

Additional Localization Scope for Financial Operations

As you know, the Configuration Localization Tool has become generally available. It allows you to localize business configuration beyond the approximately 60 non-standard countries or regions delivered by SAP, thereby streamlining your global expansion to around 160 countries and regions based on your business needs. What’s more, you can now select further scenarios in addition to the available scope with Germany as the source country. These scenarios are related to financial operations and, if scoped, grant you access to certain features not previously available:

  • Bill of Exchange for Configuration Localization Tool (7VW)
  • Withholding Taxes for Configuration Localization Tool (7WP)

To learn more, check out the Bill of Exchange and Processing Withholding Tax sections on the SAP Help Portal.

Selection of new scenarios in the Define Scope app

That wraps up the new features this time. Did you like this blog? If so, please leave us a thumbs up at the top. Also, make sure to follow the SAP Central Business Configuration tag or follow this dedicated blog collection to stay up to date with the latest blog posts.

entry.title: Re: Data transfer from multiple models to one common mode...
entry.content: Hi N1kh1l,

entry.title: Re: Fixed Installment plan for Heavy Equipment OTC Proces...
entry.content:
From your post, I could see the below challenges

  • PR00 includes the full price (SAR 1,000,000), which is correct for revenue recognition.
  • AZFP is used as a statistical condition to represent the down payment (SAR 300,000).
  • Payment Terms Z12M are applied at the header level, but SAP calculates installments on the net value, which still includes the down payment.
  • The system doesn’t automatically deduct AZFP from the net value for installment calculation.


To achieve your goal, calculating installments on SAR 700,000, you’ll need to adjust how the system interprets the net value for payment term calculation. Here are couple of options:

Option-1
Instead of AZFP being statistical, create a new condition type (e.g., ZAZF) that is non-statistical and subtracted from the net value. Assign it to the pricing procedure below PR00, with a negative value. This way, the net value becomes SAR 700,000, and payment terms will calculate installments correctly. But be cautious: this affects revenue posting and may require adjustment in account determination.

Option-2
If you want to keep AZFP statistical develop a custom routine via VOFM for the payment term calculation logic. This routine should read the AZFP value, subtract it from the net value, calculate installment amounts based on the adjusted value. This requires ABAP development and testing but keeps pricing logic clean.

Option-3
If you’re using FI down payment processing, create a down payment request for SAR 300,000, Post it via F-37 or integrated SD-FI flow. Then apply payment terms only on the remaining balance. This is more aligned with SD-FI integration best practices, especially for high-value capital goods.
